name: UC Davis Medical Center
description: Our hospital is taking steps to greatly expand its testing capabilities on-site, with the goal of running tests inside our hospital within the next few weeks. We are doing this in full collaboration with Sacramento County Public Health and other public health agencies, in order to take pressure off other testing labs

name: UC San Francisco Medical Center
description: UCSF Health has been actively working to develop on-site testing capacity for patients who are suspected of having the novel coronavirus disease, COVID-19. We do not have the capacity to test the general community at this time.

name: UC San Diego Medical Center
description: Yes, we are testing people who meet certain conditions. Our ability to test patients is improving, but testing remains limited so we cannot test all individuals. Your health care provider will determine if you meet the criteria for testing.

name: Stanford Health Care
description: Stanford Health Care’s same-day primary care program is offering drive-through testing, by appointment, for SARS-CoV-2, the coronavirus that causes COVID-19. The service is being provided to patients who are referred for testing by a health care provider based on their symptoms and exposure.

name: Kaiser Permanente
description: COVID-19 tests are available only by a doctor's order for hisk-risk patients who meet specific criteria. If you are concerned that you or a family member are exhibiting symptoms of COVID-19, please contact us first before coming in, as you need a referral and appointment to get tested

name: Walnut Creek - John Muir Health
description: Testing is done by doctor’s order only, following an in-person or phone evaluation. If you are told that you are not eligible to be tested, this means that your health care provider has determined that your risk-status and symptoms indicate that you will do best with at-home care.

name: Brentwood Urgent Care - John Muir Health
description: Testing is done by doctor’s order only, following an in-person or phone evaluation. If you are told that you are not eligible to be tested, this means that your health care provider has determined that your risk-status and symptoms indicate that you will do best with at-home care.

name: Pleasanton - John Muir Health
description: Testing is done by doctor’s order only, following an in-person or phone evaluation. If you are told that you are not eligible to be tested, this means that your health care provider has determined that your risk-status and symptoms indicate that you will do best with at-home care.

name: Berkeley - John Muir Health
description: Testing is done by doctor’s order only, following an in-person or phone evaluation. If you are told that you are not eligible to be tested, this means that your health care provider has determined that your risk-status and symptoms indicate that you will do best with at-home care.

name: Cal State East Bay
description:
To qualify, they had to have a fever of 100.4 degrees Fahrenheit or higher, officials said, but that appeared to be the main hurdle. The tests were free, and people didn’t need a doctor’s slip to take them.

“It’s for anybody, regardless of residency. You don’t have to live in the city of Hayward, you don’t have to be a citizen,” Capt. Don Nichelson of the Hayward Fire Department said. “We’ll take anybody from anywhere,” he added.

The city of Hayward set up the testing site across from the fire station at 28270 Huntwood Ave. in partnership with Avellino Labs, a private biotechnology firm based in Menlo Park.

name: Cal Expo - Verily
description: The testing site at Cal Expo is one of four sites created by a partnership between the state-directed, federally-funded program in collaboration Google's sister company, Verily and its program Project Baseline. This means that tests conducted at these sites are free, even without insurance, and results will not be shared with insurance or medical providers.

name: Ceres - Golden Valley Health Clinic
description: GVHC have two drive-thru viral testing sites, one in Ceres and one in Merced, but these are available only for GVHC clients from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. with a referral from their provider.

name: Merced - Golden Valley Health Clinic
description: GVHC have two drive-thru viral testing sites, one in Ceres and one in Merced, but these are available only for GVHC clients from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. with a referral from their provider.

name: Madera - Camarena Health
description: You will need a doctor’s referral and to make an appointment here as well. However, you don’t have to be an existing patient.

name: Torrence Memorial Medical Center
description: Torrance Memorial will be offering limited testing to ONLY those patients with a Torrance Memorial physician order and a scheduled appointment.

name: Riverside County Fairgrounds
description: The drive-up site runs between 9 a.m. and 3 p.m. Appointment times are discussed when residents call the toll-free number at 800-945-6171. Residents must have symptoms to make an appointment, which include fever, cough, sore throat, runny nose or congestion.

name: Diamond Stadium - Verily
description: Those seeking tests at the Lake Elsinore location are encouraged to use the website https://www.projectbaseline.com/study/covid-19/ for appointments. Residents can also call for 800-945-6171 appointments at Lake Elsinore.

name: Glendale Memorial Hospital
description: Glendale Memorial Hospital is now providing Drive-thru COVID-19 Testing.  Anyone who needs testing is welcome. Please note, that we will prioritize results for healthcare workers and first responders. All patients must have a physician order for testing.

name: Oakland - Carbon Health
description: A doctor’s order is not needed, but Carbon Health urges patients to first use the free online coronavirus risk assessment screening tool before seeking a test. You do not have to be a Carbon Health patient to seek a test; any California resident can get one. It takes three to six days to get results.

name: Berkeley - Carbon Health
description: A doctor’s order is not needed, but Carbon Health urges patients to first use the free online coronavirus risk assessment screening tool before seeking a test. name: AltaMed-Anaheim
description: Call (888) 499-9303 for an appointment

name: AltaMed-Santa Ana Bristol
description: Call (888) 499-9303 for an appointment

name: Nhan Hoa Comprehensive Health Care Clinic
alternate_name: Nhan Hoa Comprehensive Health Care Clinic
description: Registration REQUIRED on our website at www.nhanhoa.org

name: MemorialCare - San Clemente
description: Appointments are needed to be tested at this site and can be made by calling (877) MYMEMCARE (696-3622). A physician order is required before calling to schedule your appointment.

name: Harvest Christian Fellowship church
description: Testing is done only by appointment. Everyone being tested meet certain criteria and they are all showing symptoms

name: Hemet Global Medical Center
description: The testing sites asked that those who feel they are suffering from the disease and the elderly should call first to make an appointment to be tested at the center. Those symptoms are fever, cough, fatigue, aching all over and difficulty breathing.

name: Fremont Fire Testing Center
description: The testing center at 7200 Stevenson Blvd. doesn't require a medical referral. Tests are available for symptomatic members of the public. It's drive-thru only (no walk-up tests allowed) and you'll have to wait in your car. Schedule a test in advance by calling (510) 789-7231.

name: Kaiser Convention Center
description: The drive-thru testing center is by appointment only, and you can register for an appointment here: https://www.oaklandca.gov/services/covid-19-testing

name: Alameda County Fairgrounds
description: It's open to Pleasanton, Dublin and Livermore residents who are experiencing symptoms or are high risk for the virus. The testing site is located at Gate 12 and you do not need an appointment.

name: Piers 30-32
description: It is meant for drive-thru tests. We can accommodate those without personal vehicles. Please note when you sign up.  On April 22, Mayor Breed announced the testing site would be opened up to all essential workers, in the private and public sectors. People can make an appointment to get a test here: https://sf.gov/citytestsf

name: CityTestSF
description: This site opens Monday April 27. You can schedule a test for SOMA now. Convenient for people on foot.
